nodes.name: Telegram Bot Trigger
nodes.description: Listens for incoming messages with images from a Telegram bot

parameters.content:
## üì± Telegram Message Trigger

This workflow begins when your Telegram bot receives a message containing an image. The bot waits for users to send a photo with a caption that describes desired edits.

### Requirements:
- A configured Telegram bot token
- Images must be sent with a descriptive caption
- The bot must have permission to download files

### Output:
- Complete message object with photo data
- Caption text (used as prompt for AI editing)

## üñºÔ∏è Image Processing Pipeline

This workflow demonstrates a complete AI image processing pipeline:

1. Receives images via Telegram
2. Edits them with OpenAI's image editing API
3. Sends the edited result back to user
4. Optionally generates variations with Replicate

### Use Cases:
- Product mockups
- Creative photo editing
- AI-assisted design iterations
- Custom image transformations

## üé® OpenAI Image Editing API

Sends the image to OpenAI with the caption as a prompt for AI-based editing.

### Configuration:
- Model: `gpt-image-1`
- Format: `multipart/form-data`
- Quality: Low (faster, cheaper)
- Size: 1024x1024 (standard)

### Input Parameters:
- `image`: Binary file from Telegram
- `prompt`: Caption from user message
- Optional parameters: quality, size, n (number of variations)

### Authentication:
- Requires OpenAI API key configured in n8n credentials

## üì§ File Format Conversion

Converts the base64-encoded image from OpenAI into a proper binary file format for sending back to the user.

### Technical Details:
- Transforms API response JSON to binary
- Source: `data[0].b64_json` field
- Converts to PNG image format
- Preserves image quality and metadata

### Output:
- Binary image data ready for transmission
- MIME type: image/png

nodes.name: Edit Image (OpenAI)
nodes.description: Sends image to OpenAI for AI-powered editing based on the caption

nodes.name: Convert to Binary Image
nodes.description: Converts base64 encoded image to binary format for sending

nodes.name: Send Edited Image
nodes.description: Sends the edited image back to the user via Telegram

parameters.content:
## üß† Replicate AI Image Generation

Uses Replicate's API to create additional AI-generated variations of the image.

### Technical Details:
- Model: pixverse/pixverse-v4
- Uses image URL from Telegram's file storage
- Applies custom prompt enhancing the original image

### Authentication:
- Requires Replicate API token
- Handles asynchronous process with polling

### Input:
- Original image URL from Telegram
- Enhanced prompt for creative direction

## ‚è±Ô∏è Polling Mechanism

Waits for Replicate to process the image generation request.

### Configuration:
- 45 second wait time
- Allows asynchronous API to complete processing
- Prevents timeout errors

### Alternative Options:
- Could be replaced with polling HTTP requests
- Webhook can be used if supported by the API

## üì° File Retrieval System

Retrieves the file path from Telegram's servers to generate a direct URL.

### Technical Details:
- Uses Telegram Bot API's getFile endpoint
- Extracts file_id from the received photo
- Generates a URL that Replicate can access

### Security Note:
- Bot token is exposed in the URL
- Consider using environment variables
- Limited lifetime access to the file

nodes.name: Generate Variation (Replicate)
nodes.description: Sends the original image to Replicate for AI-powered variation

nodes.name: Retrieve Generated Image
nodes.description: Gets the final generated image from Replicate after processing

nodes.name: Send Variation Image

additionalFields.caption: Here's an AI-generated variation of your image! üöÄ

nodes.description: Sends the AI-generated variation back to the user

nodes.name: Get File Path
nodes.description: Retrieves the file path from Telegram's servers

nodes.name: Wait for Processing
nodes.description: Waits for Replicate to complete the image generation (45 seconds)

parameters.content:
## üìù Setup Instructions

1. Configure credentials:
   - OpenAI API key
   - Telegram Bot token
   - Replicate API key

2. Update the chat IDs to match your Telegram users/groups

3. Test the workflow by sending an image with caption to your bot

4. Optional: Adjust prompts and parameters to customize the AI behavior

### Telegram: Send Replicate Output

Sends the final video generated by Replicate back to the user via Telegram as a document.

**Note:** The `Chat ID` is dynamically pulled from the trigger node (`={{ $json.message.chat.id }}`).

### Replicate API: Get Result

Periodically (after the wait) calls the URL provided by Replicate for the prediction result. This node downloads the final video output.

**Note:** Replace `{{ $env["REPLICATE_API_TOKEN"] }}` with your actual Replicate API token. The `Response Format` is set to `Base64` to prepare the output for sending via Telegram.

### Telegram: Send Edited Image

Sends the image edited by OpenAI back to the user who triggered the workflow.

**Note:** The `Chat ID` is dynamically pulled from the trigger node (`={{ $json.message.chat.id }}`).
